name: apologetically
content:

in a way that shows you feel sorry for having caused problems or unhappiness: She smiled apologetically. The waiter apologetically asked if we could move to a different table. See
apologetic
More examplesFewer examplesOur guide shrugged apologetically, telling us it was time to leave.The singer suddenly started to cough and waved apologetically at the people nearest the stage.Someone from the bank apologetically phoned to ask if I'd used my debit card earlier in the day.
